Class TiGPIO

  • java.lang.Object
    • tijos.framework.devicecenter.TiGPIO

  • public class TiGPIO
extends java.lang.Object
    The TiGPIO for devicecenter of framework.

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Close the port of current object
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If a TiGPIO error occurs

      • getPort

        public int getPort()
        Gets the port id of current object
        Returns:
        the port id, range:0-7

      • open

        public static TiGPIO open(int portID,
                          int... pinIDs)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Open the TiGPIO port by port id,and return the object
        Parameters:
        portID - port id[IN],range:0-7
        pinIDs - the pin id set[IN],pin id range:0-7
        Returns:
        TiGPIO object
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If a TiGPIO error occurs
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If portID value or pinIDs length out of range

      • readPin

        public int readPin(int pinID)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Read the pin level value
        Parameters:
        pinID - the pin id[IN], range:0-7
        Returns:
        pin level value[IN], 0:low level, 1:high level
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If a TiGPIO error occurs
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If pinID value out of range

      • readPort

        public int readPort()
             throws java.io.IOException
        Read the port valid value
        Returns:
        valid value For example: if pinIDList={0,3,5}, it means pin0, pin3, pin5 are enabled value=33(0x21):pin0=1, pin1=X, pin2=X, pin3=0, pin4=X, pin5=1, pin6=X, pin7=X, X:ignore
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If a TiGPIO error occurs

      • setPinEvent

        public void setPinEvent(int pinID,
                        int type,
                        int minPeriod)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Set the pin event, have platform dependencies
        Parameters:
        pinID - pin id[IN], range:0-7
        type - event type[IN] 1.EVENT_NONE, default 2.EVENT_RISINGEDGE 3.EVENT_FALLINGEDGE 4.EVENT_BOTHEDGE
        minPeriod - the event minimal period[IN], unit:us, range:0-2^24
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If a TiGPIO error occurs
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If pinID or minPeriod value out of range

      • setPinMode

        public void setPinMode(int pinID,
                       int direction,
                       int pull)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Set the pin mode, have platform dependencies
        Parameters:
        pinID - pin id[IN], range:0-7
        direction - pin direction[IN] 1.MODE_INPUT, default 2.MODE_OUTPUT_OD 3.MODE_OUTPUT_PP 4.MODE_OUTPUT_OD_INPUT
        pull - pin pull[IN] 1.MODE_PULL_NONE, default 2.MODE_PULL_UP
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If a TiGPIO error occurs
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If pinID value out of range

      • writePin

        public void writePin(int pinID,
                     int levelValue)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Write the pin level value
        Parameters:
        pinID - the pin id[IN], range:0-7
        levelValue - pin level value, 0:low level, 1:high level
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If a TiGPIO error occurs
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If pinID value out of range or levelValue value error

      • writePort

        public void writePort(int value)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Write the port valid value
        Parameters:
        value - valid value[IN] For example: if pinIDList={0,3,5}, it means pin0, pin3, pin5 are enabled value=33(0x21):pin0=1, pin1=X, pin2=X, pin3=0, pin4=X, pin5=1, pin6=X, pin7=X, X:ignore
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If a TiGPIO error occurs
